alert.note: Alert for Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 1:20PM EST until February 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River near Salyersville affecting Magoffin County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Licking River near Salyersville. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM EST Friday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 8.5 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.1 feet on 01/22/1959. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 8 PM EST Friday.
